title: Did Miriam Webster update her entry to "sex preference" after Barrett's hearing?
subtitle: The advocacy groups described the United States Supreme Court candidate, Amy Connie Barrett, as "adversarial to the rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) persons."
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: Miriam-Webster updated his definition and guidelines for the use of the term "sexual preference" to say that its use was "assault" after October 13, 2020, the confirmation hearing of Judge Amy Connie Barrett, chosen by United States President Donald Trump of the Supreme Court.
